p: PD 404, 182, primarily a bacterial KDO 8-P synthase inhibitor, has revealed the restraining of HCV pseudoparticles (HCVpp) and VSV-Gpp entry in a dose-dependent manner, which signifies the hindrance with a process entailed for the HCVpp entry [ 71]. Fluphenazine, PCperazine, and trifluoperazine were currently recognized as inhibitors of HCV entry [ 64]. These compounds alienated the D2 and D1 dopamine [ 65, 66] and 5-HT2 serotonin receptors [ 67] in neural signaling networks.
